title: Two cases of amisulpride overdose: a cause for prolonged QT syndrome.
abst: Two cases of deliberate self-poisoning with 5 g and 3.6 g of amisulpride, respectively, are reported. In both cases, QT prolongation and hypocalcaemia were noted. The QT prolongation appeared to respond to administration of i.v. calcium gluconate.
title_plus_abst: Two cases of amisulpride overdose: a cause for prolonged QT syndrome. Two cases of deliberate self-poisoning with 5 g and 3.6 g of amisulpride, respectively, are reported. In both cases, QT prolongation and hypocalcaemia were noted. The QT prolongation appeared to respond to administration of i.v. calcium gluconate.
split_sentence: Two cases of amisulpride overdose: a cause for prolonged QT syndrome.
Two cases of deliberate self-poisoning with 5 g and 3.6 g of amisulpride, respectively, are reported.
In both cases, QT prolongation and hypocalcaemia were noted.
The QT prolongation appeared to respond to administration of i.v.
